full_text:
Introduction to Guidewire Configuration

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the product architecture for

Guidewire products

Identify the primary components for
configuring Guidewire products
Explain the relationship between the
Guidewire platform and the Guidewire
applications

Demonstrate the basic functionality of
TrainingApp

Start Guidewire Studio and runa
development instance of a Guidewire
application

| The three-tier architecture i

Three-tier architecture is a client-server software architecture pattern in which the
user interface, functional process logic, data storage and data access are developed
and maintained as independent modules

| Data tier G

* Contains the business and operational data

¢ The data is stored in a relational database which is
typically hosted on a machine other than the
application

* Guidewire supports the following Relational
Database Management Systems (RDBMS):
* Oracle Enterprise
« Microsoft SQL Server

* H2 for training and development only

| Application tier

Gi

Contains the functional process and business logic
The application logic is written in Gosu

Guidewire supports the following application
servers:

WebSphere
WebLogic
Apache Tomcat
JBoss EAP

Jetty for training and development only

| Presentation tier i

* Contains the user interface

* Each application generates a collection of standard
HTML pages that are rendered by the browser

¢ Modern web browsers support the Guidewire user
interface

* Chrome
« Firefox

* Microsoft Internet Explorer

* Microsoft Edge

| Presentation tier i

* Contains the user interface

* Each application generates a collection of standard
HTML pages that are rendered by the browser

¢ Modern web browsers support the Guidewire user
interface

* Chrome
« Firefox

* Microsoft Internet Explorer

* Microsoft Edge

| Fundamental areas of configuration i

Guidewire application-specific
functionality

| The Guidewire platform fa
¢ The Guidewire platform is a layer of configuration technology that includes the
functionality needed to define a Guidewire application

¢ Itcontains common resources and configuration techniques that are shared by all
Guidewire applications. For example:

* Data model entities, PCF files, and application logic to manage Users
* Data model entities and PCF files to create and assign Activities to other users
¢ This course focuses on the Guidewire platform

Guidewire Platform offers technology for configuring

Application Integration :
Mechanisms :

The Guidewire training
environment

| TrainingApp fa
¢ Developed exclusively for training
rainingApp ; oo.
¢ Designed to function like a contact management
application
* Stores and manages contacts and related information

¢« Examples of each fundamental configuration feature

* Data Model, User Interface, Application Logic, Integration
Mechanisms

* Small number of entities and screens

¢ Excludes complex functionality

Application Integration

Interface Logic Mechanisms

Gradle

* Open source build automation system

BH Command Prompt ao x

* Builds upon the concepts of Apache Ant

¢ Flexible and extendable

« Run tasks from command prompt

* To view available tasks, rungwb tasks ina
Command Prompt window

Gradle

| Guidewire Studio G

* Guidewire Studio is an Integrated Developer Environment (IDE) based on IntelliJ
IDEA

* Guidewire Studio comes bundled with your application as an application project
* Supports:

Gosu, XML, JAVA* 2

Refactoring =A

Plugin extensibility =

Dynamic type support

Make, run and debug

Guidewire editors

Built-in version control

| Scenario i

The developers and business analysts of the insurance company want to become
familiar with the development environment.

They would like to know how to start/stop Studio and the application.

They want to understand the high level anatomy of Studio and see a brief
demonstration of the functionality of TrainingApp.

| Demonstration G

Development environment and tools

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Demonstration G

Training App

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Review Questions

Question G

_— — Whatare the three tiers in the Guidewire application architecture?

¢
¢
¢

en

Answer a

_— — Whatare the three tiers in the Guidewire application architecture?

¢
oY” Data, application, presentation (or user interface/web clients)

BoD DD DD DS SSS oe

Question G

_— — Inwhich tier are the following used?

¢

o A) PCF files?

B) Gosu?

C) Data model entities?

en

Answer

_— — Inwhich tier are the following used?

¢

oY” A) PCF files?

B) Gosu?

C) Data model entities?

The correct responses are:
A) Presentation

B) Application

Cc) Data

BoD DD DD DS SSS oe

Question

_- — Whatis the purpose of the Guidewire platform?

¢
¢
¢

en

Answer a

_- — Whatis the purpose of the Guidewire platform?
¢
oY” It contains common resources and configuration techniques that are shared by all

Guidewire applications. For example:
* Data model entities, PCF files and application logic to manage Users

* Data model entities and PCF files to create and assign Activities to other users

BoD DD DD DS SSS oe

Question G

_- — Howdo you start Guidewire Studio?

¢
¢
¢

en

Answer a

,- — Howdo you start Guidewire Studio?

¢
oY” Open the command line in the application folder and type “gwb studio”

BoD DD DD DS SSS oe

Question G

,— — Howdo you start a Guidewire application from Guidewire Studio?

¢
¢
¢

en

Answer a

,- — Howdoyou start a Guidewire application from Guidewire Studio?

¢
oY” Debug 'Server' or Run ‘Server’

BoD DD DD DS SSS oe
